text: Penelope Ying-Yen "Penny" Wong (born 5 November 1968) is an Australian lawyer and politician for the Labor Party. She was the Leader of the Opposition in the Senate, under Leader of the Opposition. She has represented South Australia in the Senate since 2002. In May 2022, Anthony Albanese picked Wong to be the Minister of Foreign Affairs. ==Life== Wong was born in Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia. Her father is Malaysian Chinese of the Hakka people and her mother is Australian and of English ancestry. When her parents separated when she was eight, she moved to Adelaide, South Australia with her mother and her four-year-old brother younger brother, Toby. Toby died by suicide in 2002. Wong is a lesbian. Her partner is public servant, Sophie Allouache. They have two daughters, Alexandra (born 2011) and Hannah (born 2015). ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Australian Christians Category:Australian Labor Party politicians Category:Australian lawyers Category:Australian LGBT politicians Category:Government ministers of Australia Category:Lesbians Category:LGBT Christians Category:Members of the Australian Senate Category:Politicians from Adelaide Category:Australian ministers for Foreign Affairs
title: Penny Wong
